title: What we learned from women’s football this weekend: Club World Cup calls, celebrating centurions and the Championship’s secret scorer
text:
Fran Kirby hits 100 appearances for unbeaten Chelsea

The chant goes: “Super, super Fran! Super, super Fran! Super, super Fran! Super Frannie Kirby!”

The fans have had many games to perfect such a simple chant. Sunday was Kirby’s 100th appearance for Chelsea since she joined in 2015.

Since scoring on her debut against Birmingham, the 26-year-old England forward has put away 65 goals for the Blues, netting 18 last season. She even scored the club’s first ever Champions League goal when they played Glasgow City.

She won the double when she first joined, and again in the 2017-18 season. Could Chelsea possibly be on track for another this season? Their 3-1 win over West Ham on Sunday meant that they are currently the only unbeaten team in the WSL. If they hadn’t drawn with Brighton in the second game of the season it would have been a perfect start for the Blues.

After reaching the milestone at the weekend, Fran said: “It’s really special for me – I think I’ve spent a long time injured so it’s nice to get that 100, but I’m more happy that we got the win, that’s the most important thing.”
description: It’s been another busy weekend of women’s football, from wonder goals and individual milestones to trophies and trademark celebrations.
